definition: quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: The railway timetable shows the time when the trains arrive and depart.
sentences.chinese: 列车时刻表告诉人们火车到站和开车的时间。

sentences.english: According to the timetable, the train gets in at 8.27.
sentences.chinese: 根据时刻表，火车八点二十七分进站。

sentences.english: Just a second and I'll check the schedule.
sentences.chinese: 请等一等，我来查一下时刻表。

sentences.english: The new train will be formed into the regular timetable from next Monday.
sentences.chinese: 下星期一起，这列新的列车将正式编入列车时刻表。

sentences.english: Inside the station hall there is an arrivals and departures board.
sentences.chinese: 在车站大厅里有火车到站和离站时刻表。

sentences.english: B: I'll have a look in the time-table for you。
sentences.chinese: 我就替你查一下时刻表。

sentences.english: The fog disrupted the airline schedule.
sentences.chinese: 迷雾打乱了航班时刻表。

sentences.english: How long is the boat time table effective?
sentences.chinese: 行船时刻表有效期是多长时间？

sentences.english: The documents I used for performance tests contain mock airline flight timetable information. Here's a sample document so you can get a feeling for the structure
sentences.chinese: 用于性能测试的文档包含模拟航班时刻表的信息。

sentences.english: He was an intellectual who understood Hebrew but could not look up a train timetable correctly.
sentences.chinese: 他是懂得希伯来文，却看不懂火车时刻表的读书人。

sentences.english: Certainly sir, this is our train schedule.
sentences.chinese: 好的，先生，这是我们的列车时刻表。

sentences.english: Heavy snowstorms disorganized the airline schedule.
sentences.chinese: 大暴风雪打乱了航班时刻表。

sentences.english: The dog checks out the times, and then sits on one of the seats provided.
sentences.chinese: 狗狗确认了时刻表后，乖乖坐在公交站的椅子上等车。

sentences.english: I check my flight schedule and learn that my flight is delayed by 2 hours.
sentences.chinese: 我检查了航班时刻表，结果发现航班延误了2小时。

sentences.english: Let me show you our schedule.

definition: grade/class number (in school)/flight or run number/flight or run (seen as an item)/shift (work period)
train or coach service ("service" as in "they run 12 services per day between the two cities")
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
terminus/final stop on rail or bus line
bus or tram stop/intermediate stop (on route of ship, plane etc)/port of call/stopover
